Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: நுண்ணிய நூல்பல கற்பினும் மற்றுந்தன் உண்மை யறிவே மிகும்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: In subtle learning manifold though versed man be, The wisdom, truly his, will gain supremacy.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A scholar is engrossed in reading from a vast library of glowing, ethereal scrolls representing extensive learning ('நுண்ணிய நூல்பல').
Layered_Composition.Midground: Despite the library, a single, powerful beam of light, representing their innate, fate-ordained wisdom ('உண்மை அறிவு'), shines down from above, overshadowing the light from the scrolls.
Layered_Composition.Background: The library walls fade into a cosmic background, implying that even the sum of all knowledge is subject to the predestined nature of the individual's mind.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The concept that no matter how much external knowledge one acquires, the innate, pre-destined nature of one's own wisdom will ultimately prevail.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The ethereal scrolls represent acquired knowledge. The dominant beam of light symbolizes the supremacy of one's innate, fated intelligence.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The scrolls cast a soft, multi-colored ambient light. The central beam of light is a powerful, pure white-gold that dominates the scene and casts strong shadows, highlighting its supremacy.

Technical_Cues.Camera: High-angle wide shot, looking down on the scholar to emphasize the external force of fate.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, photorealistic, with mystical painterly effects for the light and scrolls.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Strong volumetric lighting for the central beam, creating dramatic god rays.

Cultural_Anchors: Acquired Knowledge ('கற்பினும்') vs. Innate Wisdom ('உண்மை அறிவு')

Negative_Prompt: dark scene, no central light beam, modern library, text artifacts, blurry.

Hyperparameters.seed: Explore variations in the color of the scrolls.
